alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 8:24AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Craig, northwestern Delaware and Mayes Counties through 900 AM CST... At 824 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles west of Adair to 3 miles east of Pryor Creek to 4 miles southeast of Chouteau. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Vinita... Pryor Creek... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Adair... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Disney... Big Cabin... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Cherokee State Park... Rose... Spavinaw State Park... Cleora... Chloeta... Sportsmen Acres Community... Strang... Snowdale State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 267 and 293. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
